pros: A team environment, with subteams within. A growing agency with opportunities to grow in your program or move around the company to try new things.
cons: Quickly growing making it hard ti build relationships throughout the agency.

review_title: Best Mental Health Facility in Town!
job_title: Licensed Mental Health Counselor in Queensbury, NY
pros: BHSN is an incredible company, that provides quality care to all clients and all providers. There are so many resources and attributes that come with BHSN to improve and help those in your community! Management genuinely cares about your well-being, and supports all employees to the highest degree. The company always provided trainings that the clinicians found appealing, to assist in personal growth as a health care provider. Supervisors all have been incredibly helpful and supportive. This is one of the best places I’ve worked! This company is also very helpful in providing individuals with direct and indirect service hours to those in need of licensure! BHSN is an encourager of growth. I personally had the opportunity to work with diverse groups, as well as engage in new therapy styles! I received nothing short of support and encouragement!
cons: All companies have their flaws, but this company has shown the ability to improve and enhance change in those flaws. This is a high speed company, that has a large caseload. Once you get the hang of the work flow, it’s not as bad as it appears!

pros: Clean nice and tidy ok
cons: Dirty sometimes clean ok ok

pros: Coworkers. You will trauma bond with your coworkers over the absolute insanity leadership puts you through.
cons: There is not enough space in the box to describe the dumpster fire the leadership and HR of this organization. They will brag about work life balance and enforcing the "whole employee" aspect - BUT its fake. They mean their work life balance. You will take on things beyond your job description, and sometimes beyond even your license. Then when you ask to be compensated for it or you ask for time off OR TO EVEN USE YOUR PAID FAMILY LEAVE - You will be fired and told they are a nonprofit and they can fire anyone at anytime without giving a reason. It is a disgusting place to work. It is high school mean girls all over again.

pros: They spend money like a for profit
cons: I Beware, women (girls) in the office are very catty.

review_title: Disorganized, run by the greed of money rather than patient-centered care
job_title: Youth Peer Support Specialist in Morrisonville, NY
pros: Working with individuals in the community, developing a rough skillset within the field
cons: No real training, lack of communication between programs/services, rude and disrespectful management, toxic workplace culture, favortism

pros: Person Centered Promote growth Flexible Supportive Team
cons: Large case loads Low Pay Strings attached with benefits

job_title: Accounts Receivable Specialist in Plattsburgh, NY
pros: One of the best things about working at BHSN is the work/life balance and the flexibility it provides.
cons: The only con for me is a 2 week pay cycle. I personally prefer a weekly pay cycle. It’s not a big issue though.

pros: Working at BHSN has many pros. Pros include, flexibility, remote option, great leadership, growth within the company, supportive staff, trainings, great pay and many more.
cons: I do not have many, but I will say this is a high pace environment as the need for mental health counseling is at a high.

job_title: Psychosocial Rehabilitation Specialist in Plattsburgh, NY
pros: I've been working at Behavioral Health Services North for going on my 3rd month now and they are extremely welcoming. They are very adamant on keeping staff happy and checking in when we are feeling overwhelmed. Overall a very inviting workplace!
cons: I did have one misunderstanding so far with BHSN, a family member of mine passed and they were very caring and concerned about my throughout the whole situation. I was under the understanding that staff were provided 3 bereavement days. However when it came time to submit my time card I was informed that those days came out of your personal sick time which was not made clear.

job_title: Child Care Manager in Plattsburgh, NY
pros:
Ability to work from home
Helping children and families in need
cons: There are no downside to working at BHSN.

pros: Flexible job. Amazing team and fantastic leader. Everyone that I have met at BHSN are very down-to-earth people and great to work with. I feel very valued and supported at BHSN.
cons: OT is not offered and since we are funded by the state, I would like it if the pay were better.

pros: BHSN has been my home for 7 years now, and I am so glad for the opportunity. Coming right out of grad school can be a very intimidating experience, so I was fortunate to get a position as a school based clinician not long after my graduation. I have been able to work with so many amazing professionals and I have learned so much along the way. I have grown my skills not only as a clinician but also as an individual. BHSN has grown substantially in the small amount of time I have been here and I am looking forward to see where and how we grow next!
cons: I honestly can't think of any.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Queensbury, NY
pros: Ability to be flexible with work hours; masters of marketing and presentation; decent pay
cons: Unreasonable caseloads of 80-100 people. Controlling environment where clinicians feel unworthy after failing to meet unreasonable standards. A lot of turnover that the agency tries to hide. Great at marketing and presenting well with little care for employees or clients - they have a “we can always find more” attitude for clients and employees

pros: What s not to like, I absolutely love my job, colleagues are amazing. This agency does some tremendous work.
cons: Sometimes traveling in bad weather is not beneficial.

job_title: Family Peer Advocate in Morrisonville, NY
pros: Very inviting environment, great team work, other staff very helpful, flexible schedule
cons: busy/fast paced, need to be very organized

job_title: Clinician, Team Leader, Coordinator, Director, Chief Quality Officer in Plattsburgh, NY
pros: BHSN is a growing agency focused on transforming healthcare to better meet the needs of area communities. This growth along with changes in the behavioral health landscape have created more opportunities than ever within the agency. Working alongside dedicated staff and the opportunity to make a positive impact have combined to create a wonderful experience for me. Now more than ever, this agency is going places.
cons: As a non-profit community service provider, the agency has historically operated on a lean budget determined primarily by government rates. This has changed for the better under the current leadership structure that has succeeded in translating the agency's strengths into new partnerships and better ways of meeting the needs of the individuals in our communities.

pros: The patients, solely. They are constantly being redirected to new providers and clinicians (due to high turnover), causing confusion and anxiety. The patients are amazing and need kind and compassionate people working with them.
cons: Poorly run all the way to the top. Insanely hostile work environment, including passive aggressive coworkers. This company is NOT patient-oriented and is more concerned about bringing in money than they are actually helping patients. You are limited to what you can do to help patients- if you are not making them money (billing for services), they will not allow autonomy. Some staff have ways of being promoted to positions with no prior experience or education- managers without education or experience are not productive, effective, or competent. Please do yourself a favor and look for ANYWHERE else in the area to work besides BHSN.

pros: I feel that I have a supportive team in my program and the people that work in all the other programs are some of the best service providers I ever met always willing to help and want to make a difference
cons: in a real job we can't expect to always have great days, sometimes it get a little challenging but we need to stay focused on the goals for our particular jobs

pros:
Great Team and Lots of room for growth : 
- ability to choose your schedule
- choose your desired population to work with
- ample trainings to attend
- team support to reach personal career goals
- abundant clinical supervision,
- access to a multidisciplinary team to offer quality therapeutic support. 

BHSN has several departments spread across the north country, all departments work well together, offering a friendly work environment and limitless growth options.
cons: Fast pace environment, a lot changing

pros: Flexibility with opportunity for growth and personal development. So many wonderful people to learn from.
cons: Human services compensation is generally not what it should be as a society.

pros: Decent number of holidays, PTO, telehealth options

pros: Great beginners opportunities to the helping field.

pros: Flexible hours, extra hours (on call, but not super often), great staff, and we have a NEW soda machine at the office :)
cons: None! So far so good!

review_title: Best Employer in the North Country
pros: Excellent salary and benefits. Staff and Administration who are truly committed to our community. I am treated with dignity and respect at all time. Supervisors who are supportive and share the same goals.
cons: I do not see any cons in working for BHSN. I will retire here.

job_title: Community Educator/Volunteer Coordinator in Plattsburgh, NY

pros:
There are systems in place to help the clients we service to give your job purpose.
There are several caring people within the company with regards to the clients.
cons: Completely disorganized from the top down.  High turnover rate reflects the "care" many supervisors have for their employees.  Employee engagement and appreciation is non-existent.  Compensation is terrible.  Time off is hard to come by.  Virtually no regimented training, very subjective between departments.  No upward momentum unless you've worked for the company for at least a year, despite your qualifications, they will hire from the outside instead so they don't have to fill your role (craziest policy I've encountered).

review_title: Great place to work, very supportive to their employees!
pros: Flexible schedule, supportive of their employees, paid time off, health, dental and life insurance, 401(k)
cons: The paper work - there is TONS of paperwork!
